result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R. Chatman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3:18 PM Defendant Michael R. Chatman in court, in custody.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Michael R. Chatman. Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing rights.  Defendant waived preliminary hearing.  Court accepted waiver, found probable cause and bound over further proceedings in both cases. Information filed with same counts as criminal complaint.  Reading waived.  Rights/elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct 1 in 22CF285 and Ct 1 in 22CF358 Court accepted plea, adjudged guilty.  Sentencing statements.  Statement by defendant.  In 22CF285 court withheld sentence and placed on 24 months probation concurrent.  Conditions:  $518.00 costs. AODA and treatment, Complete other treatment recommended by agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Submit DNA sample.  In 22CF358, court imposed 28 days jail with huber.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  22CF285 12 days credit.  22CF358 time served sentence 21 days credit.   Ct 2 dismissed and read in.  3:46 pm
to have cases set for global plea and sentence filed by Atty Allison Borsheim

11:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael R. Chatman appeared by video, in custody. Further argument from defendant for the motion. State noted no new changes since the original bond was set, opposed any modification of bond. Argument from defendant. For reasons listed on the record, court denied the motion. 11:34 AM
